channel.title: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!
channel.description:
Most of you have seen those videos where people fill a squirt gun with somethin flamable, put a match on the front, and shoot. Today I just learned how to make a miniature flame thrower.
First, find a PLASTIC (yes, it has to be plastic) container shaped like the one below. A superglue container works pretty well, but as long at it's small enough to fit in the palm of your hand. Be sure you empty out the glue, or any contents for that matter.
[img]http://img146.imageshack.us/img146/4598/bottlexv8.png[/img]
After you find the bottle, cut a little off the top of the point, so there is a SMALL opening. Now take the entire top off, and fill it about 3/4 the way with water. Then screw it back on.
Then, put a very small amount of gasoline on the tip, and light it. If you don't have any gasoline, just keep the flame from a lighter on the tip until it catches on fire.
Now that the tip is on fire, wait until the fire burns the spike about half way down. Now CAREFULLY turn it horizontal, and squeeze hard. It should shoot flames up to 4 feet if you do it right, and will spray melted plastic all over the place. Some of the melted plastic it sprays will stay lit and catch stuff on fire.
Another thing you could try, is throwing it. I have not tried it, but I can imagine that once it lands it will be shooting plastic and flames everywhere.

@jcs_double wrote:

super-soaker xp240 mentholated sprits and a lighter

item.dc:creator: @muubo muubo
item.description:
@muubo wrote:

my cousin tried somethin different he did a firework show with his dad and some friends and im talkin bout a professional show like 10 inch shells well one blew up next to the ground and set them all off and nailed him in the side of his stomach…so he got it pretty bad with his little pyro adventure lol…

item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

im not joking… he got 3rd degree burns on his arm. dang pyros. if i can find the pic he had on his myspace when it happened, ill show you
it happened about 2ish years ago i think.

oh and it might not have been WD40, even though it does work with that. I think we might have been using something else at that time, because he couldnt find any.

item.title: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!

@Zach1188 wrote:

The WD40 can blew up when your friend was holding it? Is he alright?

That would hurt :P.

item.source: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!

item.title: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

lol yea you can do that with like WD40 and stuff. just spray and light a lighter into the mist, then pull away the lighter. but if you leave it for too long the fire creeps into the barrel thing and then the can will explode, i saw it happen to my friend

also, have you ever tried ping pong balls? I know this works with butterfly models (the expensive brand lol)
i just put a lighter to the bottom of one and then the plastic stuff will start bubbling out, then when it opens, it is literally a ball of flame for up to 5 seconds. you can drop it onto the floor and kick it around in this time. i played hacky sack with it

Read full topic
item.source: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!

item.source: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!

item.title: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Lol, the first time I tired this it scared the crap out of me. There was a small flame on the spike, about the size of a candle flame. And as soon as I turned it sideways, it started to flare and startled me. So then I accidentally squeezed it. Then next thing I knew I had buring plastic all over my bathroom, and it caught the plastic bag of the trashcan on fire. So I grabed the trashcan and put it in the sink, turned the water on and put it out. So I was cleaning it up etc., then I looked at the ground and there was a burning wash cloth on the floor!!! So I cuped some water in my hands and spashed it on it to put it out.

Well, theres my story of how I figured it out.

Read full topic
item.source: [Easy]How to make a miniature flame thrower!
